description: rounded with three tiny feet; large circular mouth; small metal ring at shoulder and at ceramic handle on opposite side; incised diamond pattern on handle; textile pattern on exterior surface
medium: Stoneware with impressed and appliqué  decor
text: Excavations in the vicinity of Shanghai have yielded a unique type of unglazed high-fired stoneware impressed on the exterior with a fine woven mesh pattern. Regardless of shape or size, the wares are light, thin-walled, hand-built vessels with unusually elegant forms. Decoration is minimal. In addition to the signature overall impressed textile pattern, some handles are incised with crosshatching and appliqué spiral patterns. The exact function of these rare containers is unknown. They may have been used only for burial.
title: Vessel
